results.name: Triangle read by rows in which row n lists n+1 terms, starting with n^2 and ending with n^3, such that difference between successive terms is equal to n^2 - n.
comment: The first term of row n is A000290(n) and the last term of row n is A000578(n).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows
formula: T(n, k) = n^2 + k*(n^2 - n), for 0 <= k <= n, n>= 0. - _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 13 2016
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := n^2 + k*(n^2 - n); Table[T[n, k], {n,0,10}, {k,0,n}] //Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 13 2016 *)
program: (MAGMA) /* As triangle: */ [[n^2+k*(n^2-n): k in [0..n]]: n in [0.. 15]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 13 2016
